instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - no video/image/no backlight - no liquid damage
threads.message:
Hey guys,

got a strange board here. 

MacBook dropped on floor / no liquid damage. Thought it was a bad lcd.

chimes/boots/works externally.

replaced LCD screen - no difference.

pram reset/dfu - nothing.



where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - no video/image/no backlight - no liquid damage
threads.message:
May have broken trace, or solder somewhere.
Keep in mind, dropped machine may be nightmare.

Check 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>; internal LCD connected, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - no video/image/no backlight - no liquid damage
threads.message:
3v is there, 5v is there

<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> is not there. 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - no video/image/no backlight - no liquid damage
threads.message: just changed internal LCD cable - everything is there. jesus with us.
